intro: Narcissus elegans var. obsoletus, commonly known as the Spanish daffodil, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single, showy flower with a trumpet-shaped corona. The plant typically blooms in early spring, adding a splash of yellow to gardens and natural habitats. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy addition to temperate climates. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a cut flower.
